meanings.definition: The act of sinking or the process of sinking.
meanings.sent1: The sinkage of the ship was a slow and steady descent into the water.
meanings.sent2: The sinkage of the rock in the pond was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The sinkage of the cake in the oven was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The sinkage of the sun below the horizon marked the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The sinkage of the anchor into the sea bed was swift and final.

meanings.definition: The amount by which something sinks.
meanings.sent1: The sinkage of the boat was significant due to its heavy cargo.
meanings.sent2: The sinkage of the ice cube in the glass caused the water level to rise.
meanings.sent3: The sinkage of the pillow under the weight of the sleeper was expected.
meanings.sent4: The sinkage of the coin into the mud made it hard to retrieve.
meanings.sent5: The sinkage of the balloon as it lost air was gradual and inevitable.

meanings.definition: The state of being sunk or submerged.
meanings.sent1: The ship remained in sinkage at the bottom of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sinkage of the treasure chest in the lake made it hard to find.
meanings.sent3: The sinkage of the toy boat in the bathtub caused laughter among the children.
meanings.sent4: The sinkage of the city into chaos was a result of the corrupt leadership.
meanings.sent5: The sinkage of the submarine into the depths of the sea was a thrilling experience for the crew.
